[[Dominic Sandoval|D-Trix]][http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/03/31/dominic-%E2%80%9Cd-trix%E2%80%9D-sandoval-season-three-winner-of-mtv%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%9Crandy-jackson-presents-america%E2%80%99s-best-dance-crew%E2%80%9D-returns-as-the-new-judge-when-season-six-pre/87767 "Dominic âD-Trixâ Sandoval, Season Three Winner Of MTVâs âRandy Jackson Presents Americaâs Best Dance Crew,â Returns As The New Judge When Season Six Premieres April 7"] [[TV by the Numbers]]; March 31, 2011 | presenter = | company = [[Warner Bros. Television|Warner Horizon Television]] | country = United States | distributor = [[MTV]] | preceded_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (season 5)|Season 5]] | succeeded_by = | network = [[MTV]] (U.S.)
[[MuchMusic]] (Canada) }} The sixth season of ''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]'', also known as '''''America's Best Dance Crew: Season of the Superstars''''', premiered on April 7, 2011 and concluded on June 5, 2011.[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2011/01/randy-jackson-abdc6-starts-thursday.html "Randy Jackson: ABDC6 starts Thursday April 7"] Blogging America's Best Dance Crew; January 14, 2011[http://www.tvguide.com/detail/tv-show.aspx?tvobjectid=292224&more=ucepisodelist&episodeid=19458928 "Episode Detail: ABDC Finale at The MTV Movie Awards Red Carpet - Randy Jackson Presents: America's Best Dance Crew"] TV Guide; May 25, 2011 Auditions were held in four cities from January 21 through February 5: Chicago, Houston, New York, and Los Angeles. This season takes a different route from past seasons.[http://www.mtv.com/videos/misc/631341/season-of-the-superstars.jhtml#series=2214&seriesId=24129&channelId=1&id=1659753.html "Official Trailer for America's Best Dance Crew Season 6, The Season of the Superstars] MTV; March 11, 2011 The crews must perform to the music of one specific artist each week, including [[Rihanna]], [[Lil Wayne]], and other popular stars. This season also features special guest appearances by various celebrities including [[Justin Bieber]], [[The Black Eyed Peas]], [[Katy Perry]], [[Ke$ha]], [[Nicki Minaj]], and [[Kanye West]].[http://entertainment.gather.com/viewArticle.action?articleId=281474979145247 "MTV's America's Best Dance Crew season 6 crews revealed"] Gather; March 28, 2011 [[Dominic Sandoval|Dominic "D-Trix" Sandoval]], a former member of [[Quest Crew]], the winner of the third season of ''America's Best Dance Crew'', joins returning judges [[Lil Mama]] and [[JC Chasez]] as the newest judge. In the season finale, [[I.aM.mE|I aM mE]] was declared the winner of Season 6 and received the $100,000 ([[United States dollar|USD]]) prize.[http://www.current-movie-reviews.com/tv/2011/06/05/americas-best-dance-crew-finals-recap-iamme-rockets-to-the-top/ "Americaâs Best Dance Crew Finals Recap: IaMmE Rockets to the Top!] CMR; June 5, 2011 ==Auditions== The specific locations for the ABDC Season 6 casting auditions were revealed via [http://www.abdccasting.com/ ABDCCasting.com] during the second week of December 2010. In promotion of Season 6, District 78 released the master mixes of the songs used for the callbacks at each of the four audition cities on their [http://www.district78.com official website]. The audition dates and locations are as follows: {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- | bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="Center"|'''Location''' | bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="Center"|'''City''' | bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="Center"|'''Date''' | bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="Center"|'''Callback song''' |- |[[Hubbard Street Dance Chicago|Hubbard Street Dance]] || [[Chicago, Illinois]] || January 21, 2011 || "[[Power (Kanye West song)|Power]]" by [[Kanye West]] featuring [[Dwele]] |- |SoReal Dance Studio || [[Houston, Texas]] || January 23, 2011 || "[[6 Foot 7 Foot]]" by [[Lil Wayne]] featuring [[Cory Gunz]] |- |S.I.R. Studios || [[New York, New York]] || January 29, 2011 || "[[Massive Attack (song)|Massive Attack]]" by [[Nicki Minaj]] featuring [[Sean Garrett]] |- |Alley Kat Studios || [[Los Angeles, California]] || February 5, 2011 || "[[We R Who We R]]" by [[Ke$ha]] |} ==Crews== Ten dance crews were selected to compete for the title of ''America's Best Dance Crew''.[http://abdccasting.com/s6cast.html "Here's your SEASON 6 CAST - TOP 10 Crews"] ABDC Official Casting Site; March 28, 2011 This is the first season of ''ABDC'' to allow dancers of all ages to audition.[http://abdccasting.com/ "ABDC Season 6 - Official Casting Site"]; January 2, 2011[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2011/01/advice-for-crews-auditioning-for-abdc6.html "Advice for crews auditioning for ABDC6 from the Casting Director"] Blogging America's Best Dance Crew; January 20, 2011

==Performances== *"[[Written in the Stars (Tinie Tempah song)|Written in the Stars]]" by [[Tinie Tempah]] is played in each episode. *When a crew is eliminated, starting with the last six remaining crews, the show looks back at the eliminated crew's journey on ''America's Best Dance Crew'' while playing "[[Fly (Nicki Minaj song)|Fly]]" by [[Nicki Minaj]] featuring [[Rihanna]]. ===Week 1: [[Lil Wayne]] Challenge=== ''*Aired on April 7, 2011'' The season premiere began with the first five crews doing a dance number to a mastermix of "[[6 Foot 7 Foot]]" by [[Lil Wayne]] featuring [[Cory Gunz]].[http://www.mtv.com/videos/misc/639616/ep-1-sneak-peek.jhtml#id=1661397 "America's Best Dance Crew (Season 6) Ep.1 Sneak Peek"] MTV; April 6, 2011 {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=178268 "Songs | Ep. 601 | Lil Wayne"] MTV; April 7, 2011 |- |I aM mE |"[[Right Above It]]" featuring [[Drake (entertainer)|Drake]] |- |Phunk Phenomenon |"[[A Milli]]" |- |ReQuest Dance Crew |"[[Knockout (Lil Wayne song)|Knockout]]" featuring [[Nicki Minaj]] |- |Eclectic Gentlemen |"[[Fireman (song)|Fireman]]" |- |Street Kingdom |"[[I Am Not a Human Being]]" |- |} *'''Safe:''' Street Kingdom, Phunk Phenomenon, I aM mE, ReQuest Dance Crew *'''Eliminated:''' Eclectic Gentlemen ===Week 2: [[Ke$ha]] Challenge=== ''*Aired on April 14, 2011'' The episode opened with the last five crews doing a dance number to a mastermix of "[[We R Who We R]]" by [[Ke$ha]]. {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=178322 "Songs | Ep. 602 | Ke$ha"] MTV; April 14, 2011 |- |FootworKINGz |"[[Tik Tok (song)|Tik Tok]]" |- |787 Crew |"[[Blow (song)|Blow]]" |- |ICONic Boyz |"[[Your Love Is My Drug]]" |- |Jag6ed |"[[Sleazy (Kesha song)|Sleazy]]" |- |Instant Noodles |"[[Dirty Picture]]" featuring [[Taio Cruz]] |- |} *'''Safe:''' FootworKINGz, ICONic Boyz, 787 Crew, Instant Noodles *'''Eliminated:''' Jag6ed ===Week 3: [[The Black Eyed Peas]] Challenge=== ''*Aired on April 21, 2011'' The remaining 8 crews received a challenge from [[The Black Eyed Peas]] to incorporate into their routine. {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=178323 "Songs | Ep. 603 | Black Eyed Peas"] MTV; April 21, 2011 !Challenge |- |ICONic Boyz |"[[Just Can't Get Enough (The Black Eyed Peas song)|Just Can't Get Enough]]" |All members must stay connected for part of the routine. |- |Phunk Phenomenon |"[[The Beginning (The Black Eyed Peas album)|Don't Stop the Party]]" |Must include a "[[slow motion|slo-mo]]" section in their routine. |- |I aM mE |"[[Meet Me Halfway]]" |Must come together and create a [[robot]]. |- |Street Kingdom |"[[Imma Be]] |Incorporate [[lightsaber|light sabers]] in their routine. |- |787 Crew |"[[Boom Boom Pow]]" |Create an [[illusion]] that they are [[Teleportation|teleporting]]. |- |Instant Noodles |"[[My Humps]]" |Create [[video game]]-like visuals on stage. |- |FootworKINGz |"[[I Gotta Feeling]]" |Create the illusion that someone is floating. |- |ReQuest Dance Crew |"[[The Time (Dirty Bit)]]" |Create the illusion that they are cloning. |- |} * '''Safe:''' ICONic Boyz, Phunk Phenomenon, I aM mE, Street Kingdom, 787 Crew, Instant Noodles * '''Bottom 2:''' FootworKINGz, ReQuest Dance Crew * '''Eliminated:''' FootworKINGz ===Week 4: [[Katy Perry]] Challenge=== ''*Aired on April 28, 2011'' [[Katy Perry]] handed out a dance challenge to each of the 7 remaining crews. {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=178324 "Songs | Ep. 604 | Katy Perry"] MTV; April 28, 2011 !Challenge[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2011/04/playlist-and-challenges-for-abdcs-katy.html "Playlist and challenges for ABDC's Katy Perry Challenge"] Blogging America's Best Dance Crew; April 27, 2011 |- |Phunk Phenomenon |"[[Waking Up in Vegas]]" |Make a [[roulette wheel]]. |- |I aM mE |"[[Peacock (song)|Peacock]]" |Fan out like a [[peacock]]. |- |787 Crew |"[[Hot n Cold]]" |Make a [[roller coaster]]. |- |ICONic Boyz |"[[Teenage Dream (Katy Perry song)|Teenage Dream]]" |Make a [[wall]], then break it down. |- |Instant Noodles |"[[Firework (song)|Firework]]" |Make a [[chain reaction]] and explode. |- |Street Kingdom |"[[E.T. (song)|E.T.]]" featuring [[Kanye West]] |Make a [[spacecraft|space ship]]. |- |ReQuest Dance Crew |"[[California Gurls]]" featuring [[Snoop Dogg]] |Ride a [[ocean wave|wave]]. |} * '''Safe:''' Phunk Phenomenon, I aM mE, 787 Crew, ICONic Boyz, Instant Noodles * '''Bottom 2:''' Street Kingdom, ReQuest Dance Crew * '''Eliminated:''' ReQuest Dance Crew ===Week 5: [[Rihanna]] Challenge=== ''*Aired on May 5, 2011'' The 6 remaining crews choreographed routines inspired by [[Rihanna]].[http://www.tvguide.com/detail/tv-show.aspx?tvobjectid=292224&more=ucepisodelist&episodeid=19358886 "The top 6 dance crews on America's Best Dance Crew must use pop sensation Rihanna as inspiration] TV Guide; April 28, 2011 Rihanna's choreographer, Tanisha Scott, gave each crew a [[dancehall|dance hall]] move to be incorporated. {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=178325 "Songs | Ep. 605 | Rihanna"] MTV; May 5, 2011 !Dancehall Move |- |Instant Noodles |"[[Hard (song)|Hard]]" featuring [[Young Jeezy]] |The Head Top |- |ICONic Boyz |"[[Only Girl (In the World)]]" |Give It A Run |- |I aM mE |"[[S&M (song)|S&M]]" |The Spiderman |- |Street Kingdom |"[[Rude Boy (song)|Rude Boy]]" |The Dutty Wine |- |Phunk Phenomenon |"[[Don't Stop the Music (Rihanna song)|Don't Stop the Music]]" |The Chaplin |- |787 Crew |"[[What's My Name? (Rihanna song)|What's My Name?]]" featuring [[Drake (entertainer)|Drake]] |Gallis Step |- |} * '''Safe:''' Instant Noodles, ICONic Boyz, I aM mE, Street Kingdom * '''Bottom 2:''' 787 Crew, Phunk Phenomenon * '''Eliminated:''' 787 Crew ===Week 6: [[Justin Bieber]] Challenge=== ''*Aired on May 12, 2011'' [[Justin Bieber]] handed out dance challenges to the 5 remaining crews.[http://www.tvguide.com/detail/tv-show.aspx?tvobjectid=292224&more=ucepisodelist&episodeid=19371618 "Teen superstar Justin Bieber makes a special guest appearance on America's Best Dance Crew] TV Guide; May 04, 2011 All the challenges were based on moments from Bieber's documentary ''[[Justin Bieber: Never Say Never|Never Say Never]]''. {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=179212 "Songs | Ep. 606 | Justin Bieber"] MTV; May 12, 2011 !Challenge[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2011/05/playlist-and-challenges-for-abdcs.html "Playlist and challenges for ABDC's Justin Bieber Challenge"] Blogging America's Best Dance Crew; May 11, 2011 |- |ICONic Boyz |"[[Baby (Justin Bieber song)|Baby]]" featuring [[Ludacris]] |Incorporate [[basketball]]-inspired choreography. |- |I aM mE |"[[Somebody to Love (Justin Bieber song)|Somebody to Love]]" featuring [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]] |Perform [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]]'s famous glide. |- |Phunk Phenomenon |"[[Eenie Meenie]]" featuring [[Sean Kingston]] |Include [[Step dance|steppin']] in the routine. |- |Instant Noodles |"Runaway Love" featuring [[Kanye West]] & [[Raekwon]] |Incorporate [[chair]]s in the routine. |- |Street Kingdom |"[[Never Say Never (Justin Bieber song)|Never Say Never]]" featuring [[Jaden Smith]] |Incorporate [[martial arts]] and high kicks. |} * '''Safe:''' ICONic Boyz, I aM mE, Phunk Phenomenon * '''Bottom 2:''' Instant Noodles, Street Kingdom * '''Eliminated:''' Instant Noodles === Week 7: [[Nicki Minaj]] Challenge === ''*Aired on May 19, 2011'' The final four crews kick off the show with a group number to "[[Massive Attack (song)|Massive Attack]]" by [[Nicki Minaj]] featuring [[Sean Garrett]]. Then, Nicki Minaj challenges the crews to choreograph routines inspired by one of her unique alter egos.[http://www.tvguide.com/detail/tv-show.aspx?tvobjectid=292224&more=ucepisodelist&episodeid=19411542 "Episode Detail: Nicki Minaj - Randy Jackson Presents: America's Best Dance Crew"] TV Guide; May 12, 2011 {|class="wikitable" |- !Crew !Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=179414 "Songs | Ep. 607 | Nicki Minaj"] MTV; May 19, 2011 !Challenge[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2011/05/playlist-for-abdc6s-nicki-minaj.html "Playlist and challenges for ABDC6's Nicki Minaj Challenge"] Blogging America's Best Dance Crew; May 18, 2011 !Nicki Minaj's alter ego |- |I aM mE |"[[Moment 4 Life]]" featuring [[Drake (entertainer)|Drake]] |Incorporate childhood games in the routine. |Cookie |- |ICONic Boyz |"[[Check It Out (song)|Check It Out]]" featuring [[will.i.am]] |Create a [[marionette]] onstage. |Harajuku Barbie |- |Phunk Phenomenon |"[[My Chick Bad]]" by [[Ludacris]] |Incorporate [[belly dance|belly dancing]] in their routine. |Nicki Teresa |- |Street Kingdom |"[[Did It On'em]]" |Incorporate [[military]] drills in their routine. |Roman Zolanski |} * '''Safe:''' I aM mE, ICONic Boyz * '''Bottom 2:''' Street Kingdom, Phunk Phenomenon * '''Eliminated:''' Street Kingdom === Week 8: [[Kanye West]] Challenge === ''*Aired on May 26, 2011'' The episode began with the three remaining crews performing a group number to "[[All of the Lights]]" by [[Kanye West]] featuring [[Rihanna]].[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2011/05/playlist-and-challenges-for-abdc6s.html "Playlist and challenges for ABDC6's Kanye West Challenge"] Blogging America's Best Dance Crew; May 25, 2011 [[America's Best Dance Crew (season 5)|Season 5]] winner [[Poreotix]] delivered the challenges to the crews. After the mid-show elimination, the final two crews performed their prepared routines to make their one last plea for votes.[http://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/Randy-Jackson-2011/episode-8-season-6/kanye-west/292224 "Episode Detail: Kanye West - Randy Jackson Presents: America's Best Dance Crew"] TV Guide; May 18, 2011 ==== Challenge #1 ==== The crews had to demonstrate their versatility by creating a routine that incorporated three different styles of dance. All crews were given the same styles and songs. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=180013 "Songs | Ep. 608 | Kanye West"] MTV; May 26, 2011 ! Style |- | "[[Gold Digger]]" featuring [[Jamie Foxx]] | Dougie |- | "[[Touch the Sky]]" featuring [[Lupe Fiasco]] | Boogaloo |- | "[[Love Lockdown]]" | Isolations |} *'''Safe:''' ICONic Boyz *'''Bottom 2:''' Phunk Phenomenon, I aM mE *'''Eliminated:''' Phunk Phenomenon ====Challenge #2==== The final two crews debuted their Last Stand performances before the lines opened for the final voting session of the season. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Performance Title |- | ICONic Boyz | The ICONic Dream |- | I aM mE | Ill-emental |} ===Week 9: Battle of the Final Two=== ''*Aired on June 2, 2011'' The last two crews engaged in a three-round dance battle in the penultimate episode of the season, which also featured a look back at their accomplishments on the show.[http://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/Randy-Jackson-2011/episode-9-season-6/battle-final/292224 "Episode Detail: Battle of the Final Two - Randy Jackson Presents: America's Best Dance Crew"] TV Guide; May 23, 2011 ==== Challenge #1 ==== For the first challenge, the judges chose one routine from the past weeks in which the crews must perform again and add on to that performance. The judges selected I aM mE's Week 5 Rihanna performance and ICONic Boyz' Week 6 Justin Bieber routine. ==== Challenge #2 ==== The two crews then performed in a three-round dance battle. [[Swizz Beatz]] returned to provide the music for the battle. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Round ! Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=180013 "Songs | Ep. 609 | "Battle Of The Final Two"] MTV; June 2, 2011 |- |
1
| "Everyday (Coolin')" by Swizz Beatz featuring [[Eve (entertainer)|Eve]] |- |
2
| "[[On to the Next One]]" by [[Jay-Z]] featuring Swizz Beatz |- |
3
| "[[I Can Transform Ya]]" by [[Chris Brown (American entertainer)|Chris Brown]] featuring Swizz Beatz |} ===Week 10: The Finale=== ''*Aired on June 5, 2011'' The top two crews performed for their last time in the final episode of the season. The finale also featured performances by the five past ''ABDC'' champions. In contrast to previous seasons of ''America's Best Dance Crew'', the finale was pre-recorded; each crew taped a faux winning and losing reaction, as well as their victory performance, and were unaware of the results until the final cut of the episode was aired prior to the [[2011 MTV Movie Awards]].[http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2011/06/americas-best-dance-crew-winner-i-am-me-defeats-the-iconic-boyz.html "'America's Best Dance Crew' winner: I aM mE defeats the ICONic Boyz"] Zap2it; June 5, 2011 {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crews ! Song[http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=180576 "Songs | Ep. 610 | The Finale"] MTV; June 5, 2011 |- | I aM mE and ICONic Boyz | "[[Raise Your Glass]]" by [[Pink (singer)|Pink]] |- | [[Poreotix]] | "[[Friday (Rebecca Black song)|Friday]]" by [[Rebecca Black]] |- | [[We Are Heroes]] | "[[Run the World (Girls)]]" by [[BeyoncÃ©]] |- | [[Quest Crew]] | "[[Party Rock Anthem]]" by [[LMFAO (group)|LMFAO]] |- | [[Super Cr3w]] | "[[Power (Kanye West song)|Power]]" by [[Kanye West]] featuring [[Dwele]] |- | [[JabbaWockeeZ]] | "We Just Made It" and "Devastating Stereo" by The Bangerz |- | ICONic Boyz | "[[Yeah 3x]]" by [[Chris Brown (American entertainer)|Chris Brown]] |- | I aM mE | "[[Rocketeer (song)|Rocketeer]]" by [[Far East Movement]] featuring [[Ryan Tedder]] |- | I aM mE | "[[Written in the Stars (Tinie Tempah song)|Written in the Stars]]" by [[Tinie Tempah]] featuring [[Eric Turner (singer)|Eric Turner]] |} I aM mE was crowned America's Best Dance Crew, becoming the show's first Southern champion and ending the West Coast's dominance over previous seasons of ''ABDC''.[http://blogs.courant.com/roger_catlin_tv_eye/2011/06/west-coast-dominance-ends-on-b.html "West Coast Dominance Ends on 'Best Dance Crew'"] Courant; June 6, 2011 *'''Winner:''' [[I.aM.mE|I aM mE]] *'''Runner-up:''' ICONic Boyz ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]''|before=[[America's Best Dance Crew (season 5)|Season 5]]|after=Incumbent|years='''''Season 6'''''}} {{s-end}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.mtv.com/shows/dance_crew/season_6/series.jhtml}} * [http://abdccasting.com/ Official casting site] {{America's Best Dance Crew}} [[Category:2011 television seasons]] [[Category:Dance competitions]] [[no:America's Best Dance Crew (sesong 6)]]
